reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app declares the collection of data at various points, providing notices to users.
reply.reference: We will collect information at various points throughout a person’s engagement with a Pluss Client to be able to adequately support that person’s customer or staff experience. URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects contact information (such as names, telephone numbers, postal addresses, and e-mail addresses), app user account information (such as username and password), images uploaded by users through the app (including any personal information in the metadata), and any other personal information submitted by users.

content: Contact information (names, telephone numbers, postal addresses, e-mail addresses)
App user account information (username and password)
Images uploaded by users through the app (including metadata)
Other personal information submitted by users

reply.analysis: Based on the privacy policy document, various types of personal information are collected by the app. This includes contact information, app user account details, images uploaded through the app, and other personal information submitted by users.
reply.reference: contact information, such as names, telephone numbers, postal addresses and e-mail addresses; App user account information such as username and password; images uploaded by you through the app, including any personal information that may be included in the metadata of those images; any other personal information submitted to us by you. URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that at or before the time personal information is collected, a clear statement is provided explaining the purpose of the collection, how the information will be used and disclosed.
reply.reference: At or before the time we collect your personal information (for example, when you use our App), we will provide you with a clear statement explaining: who is collecting your information, the purpose of the collection, how your information will be used and disclosed, and whether your information may be transferred outside of Australia or New Zealand. URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection by setting their browser to not accept cookies or deleting data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that users can set their browser not to accept cookies if they do not wish to receive them, indicating the ability to opt out of data collection. Additionally, the policy outlines the process of destroying or de-identifying personal information when it is no longer needed, providing the option to delete data.
reply.reference: If you do not wish to receive cookies, you can set your browser so that your computer does not accept them. We use secure methods to destroy or to permanently de-identify personal information when it is no longer needed. For example, paper records are shredded or destroyed securely... URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: No, the app does not share data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal information will only be disclosed to third parties if necessary for specific purposes, ensuring strict confidentiality otherwise.
reply.reference: We will only disclose personal information to third parties if it is necessary for the primary purpose of collecting the information, or for a related secondary purpose that could be reasonably expected. URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third parties based on specific criteria outlined in the privacy policy.

extended_simple_answer.content: Third parties for necessary legal reasons, protection of rights, safety, compliance with law, and with user consent

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions sharing data with third parties under specific circumstances such as legal obligations, safety concerns, and user consent.
reply.reference: necessary to protect or enforce our legal rights or interests or to defend any claims; necessary to prevent or lessen a serious threat to a person’s health or safety; required or authorised by law; or permitted by another exception in the Privacy Act. Where we wish to use or disclose a person’s personal information for other purposes, we will obtain the person’s consent. URL: http://www.plusscommunities.com/privacy
